Here's a quick template for that, if you don't know how. Simply type (or even copy and paste!) the following:

[NOPARSE][The Positive Forum Movement!*](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111773)[/NOPARSE]

...it will end up looking like:

[The Positive Forum Movement!*](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111773)

\*You can put whatever you want in here. "Check out this thread!" or the like would also work.

You can even color your link:

[NOPARSE] [The Positive Forum Movement!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111773) [/NOPARSE]

...will give you:

[The Positive Forum Movement!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111773)

I'm just throwing this out there because this is a great thread, and I would love to see others link to it. Thanks for making this Deddly!

-Upsilon

I just thought i would post here to bump this up as i have been seeing the forums becoming quite sower with a few posts. 

I would just like to remind every one that with 1.0 update lots of things have changed and the things that people have been used to for the past years are now different so everyone will take time to adjust and it is best being kind and helpful to everyone.

Also with all the publicity, a lot of new players have joined that are asking basic questions that long time players think are easy and intuitive, when in fact they can be very challenging with someone new to the game. Try to support them instead of just simply posting ''Use the search''. Although this is true they should, some may not be used to using internet forums and so you should kindly point out the feature to them while also trying to help them with their problem.

Finally, SQUAD has faced a lot of criticism. Most has been constructive although some posts have been quite blunt or angry seeming. Remember guys, this is SQUAD! This is the first and only early access game that i have played that has been released successfully and i am sure SQUAD is trying their best with balancing and such however they can not make everyone happy in the game vs simulator clash. Compromises will be made and make your opinion heard but constructively. 

Most importantly, read the OP of this thread!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-29T02:02:27Z" title="06/29/2015 02:02  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 29, 2015</time> by Red Iron Crown**
  
Fixed quote

> 
> Question. What if they are the most worst people ever and they deserve to be treated poorly? Can we treat them the way they want to be treated?

What they "deserve" and what they want are probably very different. You will never regret being kind and civil with someone, but you may regret being a jerk to them even if they have it coming and doing so only increases the overall level of jerkiness here.

And yes, press the report post button, let the moderation team handle the user as appropriate so you don't have to bring yourself down to their level. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Question. What if they are the most worst people ever and they deserve to be treated poorly? Can we treat them the way they want to be treated?

As I've said multiple times in the past to multiple people: Ultimately, you're accountable for your own behavior regardless of what the other person did first. Someone else breaking the rules doesn't excuse your own obligation to follow them in dealing with that person. Always strive to take the high road; don't let someone else drag you down to their level.

And, as others have already pointed out, should there be any real need for a particular poster to be corrected, the "Report Post" button will quickly and discreetly alert those of us who are appropriately equipped to take action.
